definition: to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
bright/clear/manifest/to show clearly
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
surname Xue

sentences.english: You must stop imagining that posterity will vindicate you.
sentences.chinese: 你可別以爲後代會給你昭雪沉冤。

sentences.english: Till the party 3 in after plenary meeting, just get rehabilitating exonerating .
sentences.chinese: 直到黨的十一屆三中全會後，纔得到平反昭雪。

sentences.english: An injustice has been done. It will be righted.
sentences.chinese: 不正義的事情已經發生了，而這件事將得到昭雪。

sentences.english: They redressed the grievances done to the chief engineer years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲好幾年前總工程師所蒙受的冤屈平反昭雪。

sentences.english: Rehabilitate [the poor] at the hands of the king.
sentences.chinese: 從國王手裏爲窮人昭雪。

sentences.english: For Mr. Roosevelt believed that the men inside had a right a redress of their grievances.
sentences.chinese: 因爲羅斯福先生相信裏面的人又權昭雪他們的冤情。

sentences.english: At long last the wrong has been righted.

definition: to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
to receive unjust treatment/injustice
lit. to wash out a grievance/fig. to right a wrong/to redress an injustice
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
unjust charge or verdict/miscarriage of justice/frame-up
wronged/to suffer false accusations
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
facts of an injustice/circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice
miscarriage of justice
to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
to erase/to wipe out (a previous humiliation etc)
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
to be executed
unrighted wrong/unredressed injustice
to imprison
